snippet: TO hear its executives tell it, the Pacific Telesis Group has been knocked flat on its back by onerous state regulations. But rival telephone companies say the Baby Bell is like a basketball player who falls melodramatically on the hardwood in hop...
lead_paragraph: TO hear its executives tell it, the Pacific Telesis Group has been knocked flat on its back by onerous state regulations. But rival telephone companies say the Baby Bell is like a basketball player who falls melodramatically on the hardwood in hopes of a drawing a foul. On May 15, Pacific Telesis disclosed that its 1995 earnings would be about 10 percent lower than the previous year's. The San Francisco-based company blamed the California Public Utilities Commission, which lowered its rates and opened the state's lucrative local toll market to competition from the AT&T Corporation, the MCI Communications Corporation and the Sprint Corporation at the beginning of the year.

headline.main: Market Place; Pacific Telesis, its rivals say, is crying wolf about regulators.
